question: [File: third_party/move/move-borrow-graph/src/graph.rs] [Function: unmatched_edges()] [Edge matching correctness] Does the edge matching logic correctly identify all unmatched edges, or can subtle differences in strong/path attributes be missed? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-borrow-graph/src/graph.rs] [Function: unmatched_edges()] [Edge::leq exploitation] Can the self_edge.leq(other_edge) comparison be exploited to incorrectly match edges that shouldn't match? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-borrow-graph/src/graph.rs] [Function: unmatched_edges()] [Missing edge detection] If self is missing a reference that exists in other, does this function correctly handle that case or panic? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-borrow-graph/src/graph.rs] [Function: unmatched_edges()] [Parent-child assertion] The assertion parent_id != child_id at line 350 - can this be violated in malformed graphs and cause panics? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-borrow-graph/src/graph.rs] [Function: remap_refs()] [ID collision during remap] Can remap_refs() cause ID collisions if multiple old IDs map to the same new ID, corrupting the borrow graph structure? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-borrow-graph/src/graph.rs] [Function: remap_refs()] [Incomplete remapping] Does remap_refs() update all references to IDs in borrowed_by, borrows_from, and the main map keys consistently? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-borrow-graph/src/graph.rs] [Function: remap_refs()] [Map size invariant] The debug assertions at lines 373 and 382 check that map size is preserved, but can lossy remapping occur without detection? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-borrow-graph/src/graph.rs] [Function: remap_refs()] [Invariant preservation] Does remap_refs() maintain check_invariant() after remapping, or can remapping break edge consistency? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-borrow-graph/src/graph.rs] [Function: join()] [Join soundness] Can join() create an unsound borrow graph where illegal reference operations become allowed due to overly permissive edge merging? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-borrow-graph/src/graph.rs] [Function: join()] [Key set mismatch] The assertions at lines 396-397 require identical key sets - what happens if graphs from different control flow paths have different references? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-borrow-graph/src/graph.rs] [Function: join()] [Unmatched edge addition] When adding unmatched edges from self to joined, can this create duplicate edges or violate edge set size limits? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-borrow-graph/src/graph.rs] [Function: join()] [Join commutativity] Is join() commutative (self.join(other) == other.join(self)), or can join order affect borrow checking results? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-borrow-graph/src/graph.rs] [Function: join()] [Invariant maintenance] Does the joined graph maintain all invariants, or can join operations violate id_consistency, edge_consistency, or no_self_loops? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-borrow-graph/src/graph.rs] [Function: check_invariant()] [Incomplete invariant checks] Are the three invariants (id_consistency, edge_consistency, no_self_loops) sufficient, or are there other invariants that should be checked? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-borrow-graph/src/graph.rs] [Function: check_invariant()] [Debug-only enforcement] Since check_invariant() is only called in debug_assert!(), can release builds contain invalid graphs that cause undefined behavior? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-borrow-graph/src/graph.rs] [Function: id_consistency()] [Dangling ID detection] Does id_consistency() detect all cases of dangling IDs in edges that don't correspond to actual references in the graph? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-borrow-graph/src/graph.rs] [Function: id_consistency()] [Complete coverage] Does id_consistency() check all locations where RefIDs are stored, or can IDs be stored in unchecked locations? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-borrow-graph/src/graph.rs] [Function: edge_consistency()] [Bidirectional edge validation] Does edge_consistency() correctly verify that every parent→child edge has a corresponding child→parent back-edge? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-borrow-graph/src/graph.rs] [Function: edge_consistency()] [MAX_EDGE_SET_SIZE enforcement] The check at line 441 enforces MAX_EDGE_SET_SIZE, but what happens when this limit is exceeded - does it cause incorrect borrow analysis? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-borrow-graph/src/graph.rs] [Function: edge_consistency()] [Missing back-edge] If a borrowed_by edge exists without a corresponding borrows_from edge, can this cause memory leaks or use-after-free in reference tracking? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-borrow-graph/src/graph.rs] [Function: no_self_loops()] [Self-loop detection completeness] Does no_self_loops() check both borrowed_by and borrows_from, and is this sufficient to detect all self-references? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-borrow-graph/src/graph.rs] [Function: no_self_loops()] [Multi-hop cycles] Can multi-hop cycles (A→B→A) exist even when no_self_loops() passes, causing infinite loops in graph traversal? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-borrow-graph/src/graph.rs] [Function: has_full_borrows()] [Empty path detection] Does checking edge.path.is_empty() correctly identify full/epsilon borrows, or can empty paths be created incorrectly? (High)
[File: third_party/move/move-borrow-graph/src/graph.rs] [Function: has_full_borrows()] [Panic vulnerability] Does has_full_borrows() use unwrap() that can panic on missing references? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-borrow-graph/src/graph.rs] [Function: has_consistent_borrows()] [Borrow detection bypass] Can has_consistent_borrows() incorrectly return false when borrows actually exist, allowing illegal writes to borrowed references? (Critical)
